GUIPkg

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUIPkg.Clock

  • public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clock(float clockCyclesPerSecond)
      Creates a new clock with number of cycles elapsed per second.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasElapsedCycle()
      Checks to see if a cycle has elapsed for this clock yet.
      boolean isClockPaused()
      Checks to see if the clock is currently paused.

      Checks to see if a cycle has elapsed for this clock yet.
      void resetClock()
      Resets clock parameters

      Sets the number of cycles elapsed per second

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clock

        public Clock(float clockCyclesPerSecond)
        Creates a new clock with number of cycles elapsed per second.
        Parameters:
        clockCyclesPerSecond - The number of cycles elapsed per second.

    • Method Detail

      • setClockCyclesPerSecond

        public void setClockCyclesPerSecond(float cyclesPerSecond)
        Sets the number of cycles elapsed per second
        Parameters:
        cyclesPerSecond - The number of cycles per second.

      • resetClock

        public void resetClock()
        Resets clock parameters

      • updateClock

        public void updateClock()
        Updates the clock parameters. Only when the clock is unpaused the number of elapsed cycles and excess time towards elapsed cycles will be calculated. Clock should be updated i.e. updateClock called every frame even if it is paused

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        Pauses or unpauses the clock. While paused, a clock will not update elapsed cycles or cycle excess, though the updateClock method should still be called every frame to prevent issues.
        Parameters:
        paused - Whether or not to pause clock.

      • isClockPaused

        public boolean isClockPaused()
        Checks to see if the clock is currently paused.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this clock is paused.

      • hasElapsedCycle

        public boolean hasElapsedCycle()
        Checks to see if a cycle has elapsed for this clock yet. If so, the number of elapsed cycles will be decremented by one.
        Returns:
        Whether or not a cycle has elapsed.
        See Also:
        peekElapsedCycle

      • peekElapsedCycle

        public boolean peekElapsedCycle()
        Checks to see if a cycle has elapsed for this clock yet. Unlike hasElapsedCycle, the number of cycles will not be decremented if the number of elapsed cycles is greater than 0.
        Returns:
        Whether or not a cycle has elapsed.
        See Also:
        hasElapsedCycle
